intro: Garayanthus bicruris, commonly known as the two-winged rock rose, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit and produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are adapted to arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Garayanthus bicruris is valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
